articles.headline: Grading Teachers by the Test
articles.snippet: Use of standardized tests to measure students’ progress, and teachers’ effectiveness, has been found to have unintended consequences.
articles.abstract: Use of standardized tests to measure students’ progress, and teachers’ effectiveness, has been found to have unintended consequences.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2004, the Chinese government decided there were too many accidental deaths. China’s safety record, it decreed, should be brought in line with those of other middle-income countries. The State Council set a target: a decline in accidental deaths of 2.5 percent per year.

articles.headline: YouTube’s ‘Sunshine Girl’ Comes to Print
articles.snippet: Paige McKenzie, known for her mockumentary web series “The Haunting of Sunshine Girl,” is trying to extend her brand with a series of young adult novels.
articles.abstract: Paige McKenzie, known for her mockumentary web series “The Haunting of Sunshine Girl,” is trying to extend her brand with a series of young adult novels.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nearly five years ago, a chirpy, animated 16-year-old named Paige McKenzie uploaded a 68-second video to YouTube. “Hey everybody, so, I know this is a little strange,” she says, then confides that her house is haunted and she aims to capture the ghost on camera.

articles.headline: Netflix, Amazon and Hulu No Longer Find Themselves Upstarts in Online Streaming
articles.snippet: After years of battling traditional players in the television business, the big three streaming services must defend against a variety of new offerings.
articles.abstract: After years of battling traditional players in the television business, the big three streaming services must defend against a variety of new offerings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Netflix, Amazon and Hulu have suddenly found themselves playing a new role: the establishment.

articles.headline: At Kleiner Discrimination Trial, a Battle Between Legal Powerhouses
articles.snippet: The lawyer for Ellen Pao painted the firm Kleiner Perkins as a place that is preserving a sexist past, while the other side called her allegations baseless.
articles.abstract: The lawyer for Ellen Pao painted the firm Kleiner Perkins as a place that is preserving a sexist past, while the other side called her allegations baseless.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Silicon Valley is usually measured on its products and profits. Now, in a rare turnabout, it is about to be judged on its behavior.

articles.headline: 3G Capital, Co-Owner of Heinz, Is Said to Be in Talks to Buy Kraft Foods
articles.snippet: A possible deal, which would unite two of the best-known American food brands, could end up being worth more than $40 billion.
articles.abstract: A possible deal, which would unite two of the best-known American food brands, could end up being worth more than $40 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two of the best-known American food brands may soon unite in a deal that could reshape the industry — thanks in part to the efforts of a Brazilian investment firm with a penchant for deals.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Rebukes From White House Risk Buoying Netanyahu
articles.snippet: Tensions between Israel and the U.S. have soared, and even Benjamin Netanyahu’s critics have been astonished by President Obama’s criticism of the Israeli leader.
articles.abstract: Tensions between Israel and the U.S. have soared, and even Benjamin Netanyahu’s critics have been astonished by President Obama’s criticism of the Israeli leader.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Giora Eiland, a former Israeli national security adviser, is hardly an advocate for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

articles.headline: Wall St. Stars Join Silicon Valley Gold Rush
articles.snippet: Ruth Porat, Morgan Stanley’s chief financial officer, is leaving for Google in the most visible example yet of the flow of talent from Wall Street to Silicon Valley.
articles.abstract: Ruth Porat, Morgan Stanley’s chief financial officer, is leaving for Google in the most visible example yet of the flow of talent from Wall Street to Silicon Valley.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the country’s largest banks, Morgan Stanley, is losing its chief financial officer to Google in the most visible example yet of the flow of talent from Wall Street to Silicon Valley.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Conor Dougherty

articles.headline: Germanwings Pilot Was Locked Out of Cockpit Before Crash in France
articles.snippet: As officials struggled to explain why a jet with 150 people on board crashed, an investigator said evidence indicated that one pilot left the cockpit and was unable to get back in.
articles.abstract: As officials struggled to explain why a jet with 150 people on board crashed, an investigator said evidence indicated that one pilot left the cockpit and was unable to get back in.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — As officials struggled Wednesday to explain why a jet with 150 people on board crashed amid a relatively clear sky, an investigator said evidence from a cockpit voice recorder indicated one pilot left the cockpit before the plane’s descent and was unable to get back in.
articles.byline: By Nicola Clark and Dan Bilefsky

articles.headline: Saudi Arabia Leads Air Assault in Yemen
articles.snippet: Saudi Arabia launched airstrikes with a coalition of 10 nations. The strikes came as Yemen was hurtling toward civil war after months of turmoil.
articles.abstract: Saudi Arabia launched airstrikes with a coalition of 10 nations. The strikes came as Yemen was hurtling toward civil war after months of turmoil.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Saudi Arabia announced on Wednesday night that it had begun military operations in Yemen, launching airstrikes in coordination with a coalition of 10 nations.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and David D. Kirkpatrick

articles.headline: Kraft and Heinz to Merge in Deal Backed by Buffett and 3G Capital
articles.snippet: The merger will create the fifth-largest food and beverage company globally, with Heinz controlling 51 percent and Kraft shareholders owning the rest.
articles.abstract: The merger will create the fifth-largest food and beverage company globally, with Heinz controlling 51 percent and Kraft shareholders owning the rest.
articles.lead_paragraph: First it was Budweiser beer. Then came Burger King Whoppers. Next up was Heinz ketchup.

articles.headline: Opening New Iraq Front, U.S. Strikes ISIS in Tikrit
articles.snippet: American warplanes began airstrikes against Islamic State positions in the Iraqi city, aiding a three-week offensive by a coalition of Shiite militias and Iraqi security forces.
articles.abstract: American warplanes began airstrikes against Islamic State positions in the Iraqi city, aiding a three-week offensive by a coalition of Shiite militias and Iraqi security forces.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — American warplanes began airstrikes against Islamic State positions in Tikrit late Wednesday, finally joining a stalled offensive to retake the Iraqi city as American officials sought to seize the initiative from Iran, which had taken a major role in directing the operation.
articles.byline: By Rod Nordland and Peter Baker
